name: cryptfiend85
text: Phillipe's getup makes him look like more like the archbishop of the dump.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Do archbishops have a badge? HMMM?!

name: cryptfiend85
text: Do sheriffs have staves?

name: wehavemagnums
text: Whoa whoa! Cool it, tough guys!

name: gouldgonewild
text: A comment left by gouldgonewild was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by featurelessvoid, wittyname, Shinkicka, Mirzabah, Darthemed)

name: straw
text: Phillipe is an otter

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zem, achilleselbow, scraggg, Doc_Rostov, yingkaixing, Shinkicka, kochipoik)

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, EM2, salo, antecen, fancypants, cjk98, ConnorMc, Breadcrab, Doc_Rostov, hausea, MisterSpook, berdidaine, Shinkicka, kochipoik)

name: deovalente
text:
No, Phillipe is five.

For example.

name: trollcollins
text: Phillipe is a cosmic being who is not subject to the passage of time.

name: razorman57
text: Ok, you didn't REALLY get lamed 11 times for suggesting that Phillppe isn't five, oh wait, actually now those lames make sense. but not really

name: deusoma
text: Dude, where the Pope does his business is none of our business. Although I have seen a bear wear a funny hat on occasion.

name: tekende
text: I've seen bears do things. Things even a bear wouldn't do.

name: hyetal
text: Hm.  I wonder.

name: gournal
text: To do this is the craziest thing a bear can do

name: gournal
text: I've been too afraid to try BBCode until today- I feel like I just went back in time to middle school and was made volleyball captain of the A team instead of the B team.

name: professorhazard
text: They do if they're from Nottingham.

name: fmercury
text: I was thinking more along the lines of Marlon Brando in Apocalypse now. He has descended into the heart of darkness, and become its master.

name: cuddlefish
text: the pope only shits in the woods when there's somebody around to hear it.

name: ssddr
text: I really like this strip since its where the arc pays off. While everyone worries about philippe, he has the situation reasonably well in hand.

name: ttagxamm
text: All those horrible tales Lie Bot has told him have made him fearless .

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Ah! Lie-Bot's true purpose revealed!

name: greenkoolayd
text: indeed...  hes got douche-y ways, but he mentally and emotionally scarred phillipe out of love.

name: dominus101
text: I long for the day when I can say "I am the sheriff of the dump! Tell me where the old couches go!" in conversation.

name: epicurus
text: I actually used the last panel as my MSN avatar for quite a while, it was a big hit with winos.

name: tekende
text: That would have to be a pretty weird conversation.

name: boredom_man
text: You could say it to someone who has just shat an old couch.

name: phy
text: You could jump a motorcycle off of Carmen Electra's berm-like areolar scars.

name: ixmucane
text:
In case anyone else was wondering: "Burns that injure the tissues underlying the skin, such as the muscles or bones, are sometimes categorized as fourth-degree burns. These burns are broken down into three additional degrees: fourth-degree burns result in the skin being irretrievably lost, fifth-degree burns result in muscle being irretrievably lost, and sixth-degree burns result in bone being charred."
- Wikipedia

name: epicurus
text: Informative and scary as hell - like a zombie professor!

name: stuart
text: Yeah if you've irretrievably lost your skin I'd say you'd be unlucky to live that is basically correct

name: achilleselbow
text: I wonder if anyone has ever survived a sixth-degree burn.

name: professorhazard
text: I'd say anyone who has lost a hand or foot to rampaging lava has survived a sixth-degree burn. Do such people exist?

name: unsentletter
text:
It's gotta have happened...

And the thought of it reminded me immediately of this song =

Botch -- "Hutton's Great Heat Engine"
We'll never see them again
I won't even try to run
Because it's kind of pointless
Here comes the sea, the sea of red
It's hard to believe that our end has come
Oh she still erupts!
It's hard to believe that something so thick
Is so quick... so quick... so quick...
But it buries us by the hundreds
It's so quiet here...
And the heat is my new friend

name: greenkoolayd
text: [[high5]] botch is the hot stinky shit

name: unsentletter
text: It must happen. [squint] It must happen sometimes .

name: techiebabe
text:
And, somehow, their sight is replaced by a new sense that tells them when nights are totally moonless.
This is my favorite story arc, and that just makes it even better.

name: blarghamagarky
text: Philippe would be awesome on Kid Nation

name: baryonyx
text: Under extreme duress, Phileppe releases the Leader Within.

name: soticoto
text: Philippe is a MAN now!

name: joeyramoney
text: philippe is five.

name: soticoto
text: A MAN who is five .

name: tommycrashwreck
text: I swear, the first time I read this and saw the last panel, I just thought Achewood was going to turn into the Akira manga.

name: mulisha7
text: You do not mess with Phillipe when all he's had to eat is half a chapstick. He gets hell of indignant. He's about to lay down the law with his lightbuld/tin-star stave-of-justice.
